JobFullDesc: Microsoft 365 (M365) continues to be a significant driver of Microsoft’s success across the commercial landscape. The FastTrack service offerings help customers successfully deploy and drive user adoption of M365 solutions. When customers purchase eligible M365 licenses, the FastTrack benefit is included at no additional cost for the life of their subscriptions. The FastTrack team helps customers enable more effective teamwork, migrate data, and protect their organizations from cybersecurity threats and keep devices and apps up to date.Within the broader FastTrack framework, the FastTrack Ready Partner (FRP) program ( https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/partners/fasttrack) drives high-touch engagement with select, highly proficient partners to deliver the FastTrack benefit and value-added services to M365 customers. The FRP program motion enables scale and increased velocity to business goals through a robust, mutually beneficial ecosystem of Microsoft FastTrack, FRPs and customers.The Partner Community and Experiences (PCX) team is responsible for incubating new partner programs as well as improving partner satisfaction by creating and managing processes to make the Partner experience easier, reducing friction and increasing transparency. We are looking for a seasoned Program Manager to join our team and focus on new program incubation while overseeing our established partner support operations team.ResponsibilitiesAs a Program Manager in the FRP PCX team you will:Oversee the FastTrack Ready Partner Operational Support team.Opperational SupportWork with stakeholders across FastTrack, Partner Marketing and One Commercial Partner to address issues raised by program partners.Work directly with FastTrack Ready Partners to address escalations.Oversee evolution of processes and procedures to better execute the operations support functions.Partner Onboarding and ComplianceWork with stakeholders across FastTrack, Microsoft field, One Commercial Partner to prioritize partner nominations, onboarding and offboarding.Oversee evolution of processes, procedures, and automation to simplify partner onboarding end-to-end.Oversee partner Compliance processes and execution. Operationalize partner incubation programs.Establish, document and execute policy and procedure.Establish, document and execute success metrics and measures.Identify and recruit program partners.Lead creation of program terms or SOWManage partner relationships during pilot phase.Conduct MBR and QBR with program partners.Manage partner satisfaction.Ensure program feedback is captured.Work across organizations to ensure program success.FastTrackModern Work GTMOnline Services Usage QualificationsYou are mentally flexible and comfortable working in a fast paced and frequently ambiguous environment that is incubating new ideas. You think laterally and do not hesitate to ask questions or form your own perspective on the best path forward. You are data driven and focused on operational excellence.You implement solutions that are simple, scalable, and sustainable. You have managed and delivered projects with various teams in matrixed organizations, while influencing business, engineering, and operations teams not directly within your span of control to deliver effective solutions.You do the above with aplomb but with a measure of humility, recognizing that you do not always know it all. You are an inclusive team player and recognize healthy team dynamics as a pre-requisite to successful business outcomes.You are familiar with Microsoft’s partner ecosystem and programs, FastTrack for M365 and ideally the FastTrack Ready Partner program. Core Qualifications:10+ years of professional experience.5+ years of experience in program or projectmanagement,leading complex initiatives.Self-starter with the ability to own and drive projects with minimal supervision.Ability to negotiate with and influence other internal organizations to drive for a shared goal.Proficiency with Azure DevOps (ADO), Microsoft Dynamics and Power BIGreat interpersonal skills and ability to successfully communicate with, and present to, diverse stakeholders and audiences across the organization.Strong written and verbal communication skills.Strong presentation skills.Proficient in project management including developing project plans and successfully leading projects to completion.Bachelor’s degree in business or related field  MBA or advanced degree preferred. Preferred Qualifications:Knowledge of the FastTrack program, FastTrack approach and able to articulate the value of FastTrack.Knowledge of Microsoft 365 product suite.5+ years of working directly with Microsoft Partners in the delivery of Microsoft cloud services.PMP or similar project management certification     Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.  We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form. Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.
